page.title: 13A Mixed Farm
page.content: Dounepark Farm is a mixed farm, typical of many in our area. It is one of the main farms around Banff, and also one of the biggest. Although the farm is mixed there is a main industry. It is the beef industry. In this the farmer buys young cattle at the beginning of Autumn and fattens them up during the winter months. In the Spring they are sold for a good price. Usually they are sold for slaughter but sometimes other farmers will buy them. Dounepark Farm has two big silos for storing crops. The bigger of the two holds haylage for feeding the cattle in the winter months. Haylage is made from grass which is chopped into small pieces. The smaller of the two silos holds barley. Barley is the most popular crop in this area.
